responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Handling of User-Supplied Input in File Inclusion
    analysis: |
      The code appears to include user-supplied input directly in file paths, which could lead to local file inclusion (LFI) vulnerabilities. An attacker could potentially leverage this to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on the server.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - None
    filenames:
      - test/cgi/assets/index.html
      - test/cgi/assets/folder/test.js
      - test/cgi/assets/javascripts/app.js
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Potential Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
    analysis: |
      The code does not appear to implement any resource limiting or throttling mechanisms, which could potentially lead to resource exhaustion vulnerabilities. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
    cwe: CWE-770
    function_names:
      - None
    filenames:
      - test/static/index.html
      - test/static/another/index.html
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Improper Handling of User-Supplied Input in File Inclusion
leads.analysis: The code appears to include user-supplied input directly in file paths, which could lead to local file inclusion (LFI) vulnerabilities. An attacker could potentially leverage this to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on the server.

leads.headline: Potential Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
leads.analysis: The code does not appear to implement any resource limiting or throttling mechanisms, which could potentially lead to resource exhaustion vulnerabilities. An attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
